intro: Phyllorkis radiata, commonly known as the radiate phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
